thread.title: Snow in Spain as Torrevieja sees first snowfall for over a century - Metro
thread.title_full: Snow in Spain as Torrevieja sees first snowfall for over a century - Metro

title: Snow in Spain as Torrevieja sees first snowfall for over a century - Metro
text:
Nicole Morley for Metro.co.uk Saturday 21 Jan 2017 10:33 am A couple walks through the snow on Nino de Mula in Murcia, eastern Spain, 19 January 2017 (Picture: EPA) 
More than half of Spain’s 50 provinces are on alert for heavy snow and sleet storms. 
The warning came as southern tourist towns reported their first snowfall in decades. 
Torrevieja saw snow for the first time in 118 years. 
Authorities in the south-eastern resort town of Torrevieja said that emergency services are on alert for flooding. 
Intense sleet storms came hours after the first snowfall in more than a century coated the town’s beaches white. 
While residents in Cartagena saw the first snowfall in the area since 1939. A woman takes a selfie on La Mata beach in Torrevieja, Alicante, southeastern Spain, 18 January 2017 (Picture: EPA) Temperatures plummet in a cold front sweeping in from Siberia bringing rare snowfall to the Costas that has not been seen in some areas for decades (Picture: Solent)
